Tiene muchos años de trabajar con Ceprodel,  le han otorgado trece  créditos consecutivos, unos para mejorar su vivienda, otros para resolver gastos personales,   como el  que, en la actualidad esta solicitando ya que lo necesita para   compra de medicamentos,  pago de consultas, exámenes, ultrasonidos, para mejorar su salud y seguir luchando por el futuro de sus hijos.
Por lo que espera con seguridad siempre el apoyo que ha recibido en créditos anteriores, Agradeciendo siempre a esta institución.
texts.en:
Victoria del Carmen is from the town of El Sauce.  She currently works as a teacher in an elementary school in the town.  She has a lot of experience as a teacher and teaches elementary school children to read and write.  It is a job that she is passionate about and it allows her to provide her household with their daily bread.

Victoria's family consists of her three children, two of whom are still in her care and are studying at university.  With her small teacher's salary and a small amount of help from her children's father, she is working as hard as possible to prepare them professionally so that they can enjoy a better future.

Victoria has been working with Ceprodel for many years.  She has received 13 consecutive loans, some for improving her home and others to cover personal expenses such as the one she is currently requesting.  Victoria needs this loan to buy medicines and pay for check-ups, exams and ultrasounds so that she can improve her health and continue working hard for her children's future.

She hopes to receive the same support she has received with her previous loans.  She is, as always, grateful to the institution.

loans.use: to cover medical expenses, pay for check-ups, exams and ultrasounds

loans.name: Nestor Roberto

texts.es:
Nestor tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de imperial, Ciudad que se caracteriza por la importante actividad comercial de sus habitantes. En sus alrededores se encuentra la Fortaleza de Ungará, último vestigio de la Cultura Huarco, antiguo Cañete. También se hallan antiguas haciendas instaladas entre las extensas áreas de cultivo, es padre de 2 pequeños hijos de 11 y 12 años de edad, a los cuales ama muchísimo, por razones ajenas la madre de sus hijos los abandono hace ya varios años y el tuvo que iniciar una nueva vida para sacarlos adelante, y por los cuales lucha cada día por darles lo mejor; el estudio Mecánica automotriz, pero como le gustaba la fotografía se inscribió en un curso y también se compro una cámara, pero un día fue víctima de un robo y perdió la cámara lo cual hiso que ya no pueda seguir estudiando.

Con mucho esfuerzo Nestor trabaja actualmente como chofer de mototaxi, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 50 clientes en el día, en algunas ocasiones trabaja en obras de construcción ya que el nos comenta que cualquier trabajo es bueno sobre todo cuando es honrado, el cree que le va bien en su negocio trabaja en un horario que le permite transportar a mucho mas pasajero y poder pasar más tiempo con sus hijos.

Nestor está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá construcción una cochera, con esta mejora poder tener un lugar seguro para guardar su mototaxi, así  ya no tendrá que guardar su mototaxi en otro lado y tendrá un ingreso mas, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Darle una buena educación sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Nestor is 41 years old and lives in the town of Imperial.  This town is noted for the high level of commercial activity among its residents.  In the surrounding area one finds the Ungara Fortress, the last trace of the Huarco culture, ancient Cañete.  There are also old haciendas on vast expanses of farmland.

Nestor is the father of two young children who are 11 and 12 years old.  He loves his children very much.  The children's mother left him several years ago and he had to start a new life in order to provide for his children.  He works hard for his children every day so that he can provide them with the best in life.  Nestor studied auto mechanics.  As he also enjoyed photography, he signed up for a course and bought a camera but one day he was mugged and lost the camera.  This meant he was not longer able to continue studying.

Nestor currently works very hard as a motorcycle taxi driver.  He works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 50 customers a day.  Sometimes he also works on construction sites because he tells us that every job is good, especially when it is honest.  Nestor believes that his business is doing well.  He works hours that allow him to transport a lot more passengers and spend more time with his children.

Nestor is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he will be able to build a garage.  This improvement will provide him with a safe place to keep his motorcycle taxi and he will no longer have to keep it elsewhere which will give him more money and he will be able to continue working towards his biggest dream: to provide his children with a good education and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to build a garage

loans.name: Joseph Henry

texts.en: Joseph Henry lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is 67 years old and married with ten children. He saved his salary and cultivated crops, and later on he diversified to poultry and piggery which enabled him to buy a cow. His dream is to build a permanent home and diversify his business. Seasonal weather and price fluctuation hinder his business. Joseph wants a loan to clear land and plant maize.

loans.use: to clear land and plant maize.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, age 33, is married to Berryl who runs a salon. They are blessed with one child. Moses repairs cars and also sells motor vehicle spare parts. The business gives him a monthly income of about KES 50,000.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD and he has a good credit history. He will use the funds to buy screwdrivers, spanners and other motor spare parts for resale. He hopes to own a garage in the future.

loans.use: To buy tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a forty-two-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a farmer for the last ten years and the major hardships are price fluctuations, inadequate capital to purchase stock and seasonal weather. However, he has a vision of expanding his farm to new areas and buying land to grow crops. Wilson needs a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline, age 33, is a single mother of one child, age 18 years old. Jackline sells clothes and has been doing this for four years. The business earns her a monthly income of about Kshs 15,000.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD and she has repaid the previous loans successfully. She will use the funds to buy new clothes for resale. She intends to use the expected profits to pay school fees for her child, and she hopes to buy a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, age 40, is married and blessed with four children between the ages of 6 and 18 years. She runs a retail shop that gives her a monthly income of about Kshs 34,000.

This is her fifth loan term with KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy sugar, flour, rice and cooking oil. Catherine intends to use the anticipated profits to educate her children, and she hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 55 years old and sells clothes in Voi town. He is married and a father of three children. He has been selling clothes for the past ten years and he is doing great. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a client, and this marks his third loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase more bales of shirts, trousers and skirts to sell to the residents of Voi. 

He will use the anticipated profit to purchase his own lot and build a business premises. He hopes to have a more profitable business and thus be able to live a happier, more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of shirts, trousers and skirts.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 37 years old. She is married to Nelson and together they have two children. She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the last six years. She was brought to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. This will be her first loan. She will use the amount to pay school fees for her child. She hopes to expand her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Yovan

texts.en:
Yovan is a 46-year-old man with eight children. He runs a local brew business, which he has operated for a period of 15 years. He earned the capital to start his business by farming. Price fluctuations and high fuel prices are factors affecting his business. 

Yovan dreams of having all his children educated and building a permanent home. He Intends to go back and start farming so as to diversify his income sources. Yovan wants a loan to buy land for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy land for cultivation.

loans.name: Nillecil

texts.en:
Nillecil is 28 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel. She is married with 4 children. Nillecil works in the fishing industry, catching and selling fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. 

She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase gasoline, hooks, and maintenance for the pump boats. Nillecil has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, she hopes to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline, hooks, and maintenance for the pump boats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hides and skins for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more grocery stock and charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a single mother of two. Eunice is a dairy farmer and began this business through the sale of milk from her cow.

She was introduced to Milango last year. Eunice is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to construct a milking shed and repair her ranch. Eunice will save the extra income for emergencies and her ambition is to buy more than ten cows in future.

loans.use: To construct a milking shed and repair her ranch.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of five and runs a vegetable shop. The business has been in operation for the last ten years. She started the business with little capital, about $6, and has seen the business grow to a moderate level with daily sales of $12.
She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of coconut, fruits and vegetables for sale. 
Mary’s business faces the challenge of high cost of transportation. She looks forward to opening a retail shop in future, and will use the extra income to purchase more stock.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of coconut, fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Ligia Aurelia

texts.es:
Ligia Aurelia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre soltera con tres hijos a su cargo los cuales los está preparando profesionalmente. Se gana la vida como comerciante,  su negocio consiste en brindar servicio de un pequeño cafetín a los pobladores de dicho municipio, este  ofrece todo tipo de comidas y bebidas,  todos los días de la semana.

Cabe señalar que tiene muchos años de tener este negocio, el cual le ha  permitido llevar el sustento a su familia, acondicionar su vivienda. Desde que falleció su esposo ha luchado arduamente como madre responsable para mantener a sus hijos y darles todo para un futuro mejor.

Es el segundo crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para invertirlo en la compra de perlines y pintura, ya que está ampliando su negocio, con el fin de darles una mejor atención a sus clientes, por lo que espera el apoyo de dicha Institución para lograr su objetivo, y seguir adelante ganándose la vida de la mejor manera posible.
texts.en:
Ligia Aurelia is from the El Sauce municipality.  She is a single mother with three children under her care.  The children are studying to become professionals.  She earns a living as a small businesswoman.  Her business consists of offering the services of a small coffee shop to the villagers of the municipality.  She offers all types of food and drinks every day of the week.

It is worth pointing out that she has had this business for many years.  This has allowed her to provide sustenance for her family and to make improvements to her home.  Ever since her husband died she has struggled arduously as a responsible mother to support her children and to give them everything for a better future.

This is the second loan that she has requested from Ceprodel.  She will use it to buy purlines and paint because she is expanding her business.  She is doing this in order to give her customers better service.  She hopes to have Ceprodel’s support in order to achieve her objective and to get ahead earning a living in the best way possible.

loans.use: to buy purlines and paint.

loans.name: Naomy

texts.en:
Naomy is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a married mother of two and runs a retail shop which has been in operation for a year. Naomy is also a farmer. She started the retail shop by selling her produce.

Naomy is applying for a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock like flour, sugar etc. for her shop. She looks forward to increasing her business in future, but will save the extra income from this loan. Her only challenges are high cost of living, seasonal business environment and transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock like flour, sugar etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Clovis

texts.en: Clovis used the previous loan to buy cattle and local brew for selling at a profit. He faces a challenge of price fluctuation and seasonal weather. His dream is educating his children and diversifying the business. Clovis needs this loan to buy a plot of land so as to construct a commercial house.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land  so as to construct a commercial house.

loans.name: Constansio

texts.en: Constansio used the previous loan to purchase goats for sale. In her business,she faces a challenge price fluctuation and inflation. Her dream is educating her children and diversifying her business. Constansio needs this loan to buy goats for sale.

loans.use: to buy goats for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in the Coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of three and owns a charcoal sales business which has been running for nine years. Susan joined Milango after an invitation from her friends to access credit.

She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to pay for school fees and other projects. Susan’s business faces the challenges of seasonal business climate and high transportation costs.

loans.use: To pay for school fees and other projects.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a single lady who lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She sells clothes, a business she has run for the last five years.

After an invitation from her friends, Ruth joined Milango to access credit. Ruth is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase new stock of clothes. Her main challenges are some customers not paying on time and high cost of fuel.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes.

loans.name: Banly

texts.en:
Banly is from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province, where most of the fertile land is located.  She is a mother of two-school age children who live with her and her spouse.  She is in the business of cultivating rice.  It’s the only business she has been with, for over 10 years.  She believes she earns a low income because her family doesn’t own a wide farmland like other villagers. 

What she intends to do next, is to expand her farmland and thereby increase her good output of rice.  In order to attain her dream, Banly decided to request some funds from HKL and Kiva for the first time, to purchase a plot of land located close to her house.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete the process for his driver’s license.

loans.name: Seak

texts.en:
Seak is a 27-year-old man who has a spouse as his life partner for many years. He has been blessed with a lovely young child, living with him in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province. The main business of the family is growing and selling crops. He usually grows rice and beans as well as vegetables. After harvesting the crops, he and his wife sell them in a local market at a profitable price.

Seak would like to have this loan to pay for a plowing fee, which will help him to start growing a bean crop in the new season. For his business goal, Seak wants to have his own store for stocking and selling his bean stock.

loans.use: to pay for a plowing fee.

loans.name: Kao

texts.en:
Kao is 50 years old, married, and a responsible mother of eight children. She lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has spent most of her lifetime dedicated to farming, cultivating rice and potatoes. She works alongside her spouse and two children who help her in this business.

At present Kao would like to acquire some funds from HKL and Kiva to pay for rented land, on which she is preparing to plant potatoes in a new cycle. This is Kao's first loan with our MFI. It will be very useful for Kao’s family’s business. It will enable her to further improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for rented land

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun is in her 50s. She is a single parent with six children: three are married and three are single and living with her in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Soun works in agriculture, cultivating rice in both seasons of the year. She is able to generate a suitable income to support her daily expenses.

The purpose of this loan is to pay back money to the owner of the farmland, from whom she bought her land in a previous year. Soun is very grateful for the loan, which helps to solve her financial difficulties. She is confident she will be able to pay back her loan to our kind lenders.

loans.use: to pay for farmland.

loans.name: Nkaiwatei

texts.en:
Nkaiwatei has a good history with KADET LTD. This is his fourth loan, which he plans to use to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds, and chemicals and also to buy animals for fattening. He intends to use the return from the loan to plow back into farming and in part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his children to a high level of education. He is hard-working man who struggles to achieve if funded.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Soeun is 29 years old and from Prey Chor district. She is a humble and diligent farmer. She has a common law relationship with her husband who works in the same type of business. This couple has been blessed with three children, all of whom are attending school and depending on their income. After the rice season, Soeun wants to use her free time to raise pigs at home. However, she doesn’t have enough capital to start this business. Consequently, she would like to ask for her first loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase pigs. Soeun plans to have a medium farm for fattening pigs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Y

texts.en:
Y, age 49, is a married woman and a mother of three children. She is in the business of cultivating rice from the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has been in this business for more than six years. 

She usually grows rice both in the rainy season and the dry season because she gets water from the nearby river to cover the rice crops in case there is not enough rain. So, it is not a problem for her to manage this business. 

Y is now seeking a loan from HKL to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her family. With the remaining money, she will buy seeds and fertilizers for her dry-season rice this year. Her business goal is to have a farm for raising poultry, especially chickens and ducks.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her family.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 23 years old and single. He owns an electronic shop and has been in the business for the past one year. He gets a monthly income of KES 5,000.

He was brought to KADET LTD by a KADET client. This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase wires,radios and switches for stock in his business.

His hopes to purchase a piece of land to diversify his business.

loans.use: to purchase wires, radios and switches for stock in his business.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon has borrowed a second loan, of KES 10,000, from KADET LTD after repaying his previous loan successfully. He wishes to use this loan to purchase herbicides and tea seedling. The profits will be used to educate his school-going children.

He hopes to expand his tea plantation and live a happy life.

loans.use: to  buy  herbicides and tea seedling for his farm.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has operated his retail business in Nakuru town for the last five years.  He is 30 years old, married to Teresiah and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods, especially bags to add to his stock.

In the future, Peter hopes to grow his retail business to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more handbags to sell

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement has been in farming in Nakuru town for the last 15 years. He is 72 years old and married with two grown up children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client of KADET. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more seedlings and polythene bags to add to his stock.

In the future, Clement hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Nakuru area.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and polythene bags.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has operated in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last 12 years. He is 29 years old, married to Jane, and they have two children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He will use the loan amount to establish a bread bakery to boost his income.

In future, Wilson hopes to establish a stable bakery and become one of the famous business man.

loans.use: to diversify his business to add a bread bakery.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut is a 48-year-old married woman who resides in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is involved in a business growing crops. The most common crop is rice, which she usually grows every season of the year. Her spouse is supportive and helps manage the maintenance of the rice field. Khut has five children, one of whom is married and lives independently. To support the family, one of her sons works at a fishing business. He catches fish from the nearby river and sells them. Unfortunately, some of his fishing materials were broken. This makes Khut’s household income decrease. To solve the problem, Khut is taking out a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase a new boat and fishing net to support her son in his business. In the future, Khut wants to save money to repair and decorate her present house because it seems too old and is not comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat and fishing net

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum is a resident of Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She works as a public primary school teacher and receives a decent salary. She is married to her spouse, who is also a teacher. This couple has been blessed with three children who completely depend on their income. Besides teaching, Chum has been operating a retail business from a rented booth located in her school. She sells snacks, soft drinks, sweet things, and other school supplies. As of now, her retail business has run out of inventory. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from HKL to buy merchandise again. With the increase in her income, Chum will save it to further develop her retail business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail booth

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en:
Tuon is an uneducated mother who works in rice husbandry to earn her livelihood. She has tried hard to support her children’s education because she wants them to have a bright future and alleviate poverty through education. She is now 36 years old and has three single children attending school in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. 

Presently, Tuon is experiencing financial difficulties. She needs money to buy construction supplies to build her house. Therefore, Tuon is applying for her third loan from HKL. She feels very happy and thankful for the help from our lenders.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to build her house.

loans.name: Yea

texts.en:
Cultivating rice is the main business activity for Yea’s family. Thus, most of her income is generated from the rice field. Yea and her spouse have been involved in this business since 2007. Her business location is in the Prey Chor district of the Kompong Cham province. Yea has eight children, three of whom are employed, working in various jobs in Phnom Penh city.

With the second loan from HKL, Yea would like to buy a strong ladder and timbers for construction of her house. Through using this loan, Yea hopes  she’ll be able to have a nice, comfortable house for living. Her business goal is to build a wooden pigpen and place some pigs in there for raising to uplift her family’s household income.

loans.use: to buy a strong ladder and timbers for construction of her house.

loans.name: Moses Eyapan

texts.en: Moses still sells charcoal, firewood , and the business is doing well. He has requested for a loan worth KES. 70,000 to buy more charcoal  and firewood for sale. Profit earned will be used to increase his stock and educate his children. His dream is to buy a land and establish her business, this is his third loan.

loans.use: to purchase 15 bags of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 56 years old. She is a single mother of two children. She has been selling soft drinks for the last  eight years with good income. 


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. This is her first loan from KADET LTD, she will use the loan amount to buy more soft drinks for sale. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 34 years old. He is married with three children. He has been selling spare parts and has been in the business for the past 16 years.

He was brought to KADET Ltd. by a KADET Ltd. client. He will use the loan amount to purchase stock of spare parts for sale in his business.

He hopes to venture into a transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of spare parts

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 44 years old, married to Joyce and has two children. He has been in the transport business in Naivasha for the last ten years. 

This will be Christopher’s third loan. He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and paid off his previous two loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy a new motorcycle. 

In the future Amos hopes to buy a pickup truck which he will use to transport goods around the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 56 years old and married to Raphael, who contributes to the family income. She supports two members of her family. 

She has been running her retail shop for a period of about eight years with a good income.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous ones well and in good time. 

She wants to use the loan to buy stock, such as sugar, cooking oil, cabbages, tomatoes and salt. 

In future, she hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase stock, such as sugar, cooking oil, cabbages, tomatoes and salt.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is from Villalin Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Victoria is married and has three children. 

Victoria owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Victoria has been engaged in her business for five years and earns 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Victoria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business. Victoria is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Cotilda

texts.en:
Cotilda  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). Cotilda has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for four years, and she works 6 days a week. Cotilda sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Cotilda has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling piped water. The main business challenges for Cotilda include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for charcoal and to buy a motor van to ease transportation. Cotilda lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two orphans, a niece and nephew).  

Sophie has a business of selling African Attire(bitenge). These are clothes made by dying worn all over Africa by both men and women. She has been in this business for one year, and she works six days out of every week.  Sophie sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Sophie has requested  for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of African Attires. She also generates additional income by working as a health worker at Kawempe. The main business challenges for Sophie include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to buy a heavy duty sewing machine. Sophie lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of African Attire (bitenge).

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia lives in Uganda.  She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (old parents).

Jalia has a business of selling second-hand clothes.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works six days out of every week.  She sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Jalia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothing materials.  The main business challenges for Jalia include rainy  season because she works in an open place and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to build her own house.  Jalia lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used second hand clothes

loans.name: Sanyu

texts.en:
Sanyu  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). Sanyu has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for nine years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sanyu sells her products in her shop, retail. Sanyu has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of  sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. 
   
The main business challenges for Sanyu include rainy season and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale and to build her own house.   

Sanyu lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and rent.   
.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of soap, bags of sugar, cartons of salt and cooking oil

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her brother’s daughter). 

Teopista has a business selling roasted maize and cassava.  She has been in this business for seven years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Teopista sells her products at the market on retail basis. Teopista has requested  for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of maize and  bags of cassava. 

The main business challenges for Teopista include seasonality and transportation of maize and cassava from villages to her place of work.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell on  wholesale only and to  buy  a plot of land in order to start growing maize and cassava in.  Teopista  lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of maize and bags of cassava

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  

Jesca has a business selling curry powder.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week.  Jesca sells her products at the market by means of wholesale.   She also generates additional income through selling piped water.

Jesca has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more raw materials for making curry powder. The main business challenge for Jesca include the transportation of packets of curry powder from her home to the respective markets.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to build her own house.    

Jesca lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make curry powder

loans.name: Rosslyn

texts.en:
Rosslyn lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She runs a greenhouse from where she grows vegetables. She sold her house and also added her savings to the fund in order to start the business.
Rosslyn was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan 95,000 Kenya shillings to purchase greenhouse fertilizers and pesticides.
The main challenges facing the business are the high cost of purchasing materials, diseases, and lack of skilled human resources. The extra income from the loan will help Rosslyn purchase pesticides and water for irrigation.

loans.use: To purchase greenhouse fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Rojas

texts.en:
Rojas is a married man. He has two children, two and five years old. He describes himself as a devoted Christian. He operates a retail business where he sells furniture such as beds, sofa sets, coffee tables, wall units etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located at a busy and viable area and his primary customers are from the middle-earning class.

Rojas describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the furniture-selling business. He will be using the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more furniture. Rojas' business goal is to venture into a new business of an auctioneer for real estate  within five years.

loans.use: to buy more furniture for selling.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman. She has a daughter who is five years old. She describes herself to be a religious woman. She operates a greengrocery store  where she sells vegetables and fruits such as cabbages, tomatoes, mangoes, carrots, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a good market area and her primary customers are market visitors. 

Lilian describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of tomatoes. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more vegetables and fruit. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of vegetables and fruit within five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 35-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 4 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located at a viable area and her primary customers are both men and women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of charcoal . She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more charcoal. Her business goal is to venture into new business of running a big restaurant in her town area within five years.

loans.use: to buy more  charcoal  for selling.

loans.name: Trustees Group

texts.en: Daniel  is a 28 year old single man who lives in his own apartment at Mpatosie, a suburb of Berekum. He operates a grocery shop and sells items like milk, assorted drinks, cooking oil, toiletries etc. He has been in business for the past 6yrs. He will use the loan to purchase additional stock of goods to expand his business. He belongs to the community group called Trustees Trust Group. The group guarantees a loan through a repayment pledge and provides assistance for one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods for his grocery store.

loans.name: Akoi Allah Group

texts.en:
Fatima is a 45-year-old hardworking mother. She is married with five children who are currently in school. She manufactures local soap. Her major challenge over the years has been funds to scale up the business. She is very confident that the loan will enable her to make remarkable business growth. She wants to use the loan to purchase more raw materials such as palm oil and soda. She also wants make quality education available to her children to enable them become more resourceful in the future. 

Fatima is a member of a group called “Akoi Allah” Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials such as palm oil and soda

loans.name: Mohamed M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you this group of secondary school teachers from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. Like their colleague teachers from other schools within SMT’s operational areas, these teachers have applied for this loan in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they repay the loan using their monthly salaries. The bursar is directly responsible for doing the repayment on their behalf.

Thirty-two year old Mohamed is the leader of this group of teachers. A native of Koamba village in Southern Sierra Leone, Mohamed is married to a trader and the couple has 2 children, 1 in primary school and the other is not of school going age. Mohamed has served in the teaching profession for 4 years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy household furniture to decorate his home.

loans.use: to buy household furniture to decorate his home.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man. His wife is a hotel manager. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 16 years. He describes himself to be social and disciplined.

He operates a restaurant where he sells food, tea, and snacks. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located at a very busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of a spacious restaurant for operation.

He will use the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase ingredients. His business goal is to run a big hotel within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a Kiva borrower. He has two children, ages 6 and 12 years. He describes himself to be an honest man. 

He operates a vehicle for providing transportation services. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located at a strategically busy area and near a hospital. His primary customers are residents and patients. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase motor vehicle tires. His business goal is to own his dream car so as to improve his transportation services within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be offering the best transportation services.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle tires.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en: Eliud is a married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 24 years. He describes himself to be ambitious, motivated and a God-fearing man. He operates a retail store where he sells pillows of different colours. For 20 years, He has been involved in this business. His business is located in a very busy town centre and his primary customers are local residents and townspeople. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of pillow materials. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase pillow materials. His business goal is to run several such retail stores within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make pillows for selling

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 32-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Al Balqa'a, Jordan, and the mother of two children.

Through watching her neighbor, Nada learned how to do mosaics. She liked that and engaged in a course at the Jordanian vocational institution to have a solid experience for making mosaics. After that she started her own business.
 
Now, Nada is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to purchase materials and equipment needed for making mosaic templates.

Nada is looking establish a workshop for her business and to train her women neighbors to make mosaics so that she can help them to have an additional source of income through employing them at her workshop.

An aspiration of Nada is to purchase her own house instead of the current rented one.

loans.use: to purchase materials and equipment needed for making mosaic templates.

loans.name: Sana'a

texts.en:
Sana'a is a conservative person and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. Thus, the woman in the photo is her daughter.

Sana'a has a beauty salon and she is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to purchase a skin care machine.

Sana'a is looking to improve her family's life conditions and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a skin care machine.

loans.name: Wesal

texts.en:
Wesal is a 42-year-old married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan and a mother of six children.

Wesal has a small shop selling home products and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more products for business purposes.

Wesal is looking to establish a bigger shop for her business so that she can enlarge her customer base and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase home products for business purposes

loans.name: Abd Al Azeez

texts.en:
Abd Al Azeez is a 38-year-old married man from AL Balqa’a, Jordan and a father of two children.

Abd Al Azeez has a small grocery store and is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase goods for the store.

Abd Al Azeez is looking to expand his business and purchasing a van for his store so that he could distribute his products door-to-door. He is also dreaming of purchasing a home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase goods for his grocery store

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a 48-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and the mother of five children.

Yusra is looking to improve her family's life conditions. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to to do maintenance for her home.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a 27-year-old food stall owner in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married. She has been selling food for the past three years and the business is doing great.

This marks her second business loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to purchase assorted food, new chairs, tables and serving dishes. 


She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to excel in the business

loans.use: to purchase assorted food, new chairs, tables and serving dishes.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has no children.
 
Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her third loan from BRAC. 

She has requested a loan of 1,500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in Bor. She sells food and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children;  two of them are still in school. 

Martha heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 SDG in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans for sale.

loans.name: Deysi Dolores

texts.es:
Deysi, tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo y cinco hijos de 25, 22, 20, 18 y 9 años de edad, ella junto a su esposo atienden  labores agrícolas y ganaderas, tienen vacas en su lugar de residencia, sus hijos tambien le apoyan para algunas labores.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de quintales  de concentrado para el ganado, esto le ayudara para que su ganado se mantenga y produzca leche.
El objetivo de Deysi es apoyar a su esposo, que su ganando cuente con lo necesario en alimentación ya que así producirán más leche.
texts.en:
Deysi, age 39, lives with her husband and her five children, ages 25, 22, 20, 18 and 9.  She and her husband tend to the farming and livestock work together.  They have cows where they live.  Their children also help them with some of the work.

She is requesting a loan to buy “quintales” (1 quintal = 100 kg) of concentrated feed for the livestock.  This will help her maintain the livestock, and it will help with milk production.

Deysi’s objective is to support her husband and for her cattle to have the food they need.  This way they will produce more milk.

loans.use: to buy “quintales” (1 quintal = 100 kg) of concentrated feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 46 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her store.

Remedios has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, soap, sugar and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Remedios would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 55-year-old married woman, mother of three children. Thirty-nine years ago, Fatima started working as a tailor. This long experience gave her customers trust and made them supportive. Most of Fatima's customers are neighbors, relatives and friends.

Fatima is a hard-working woman who sacrifices her life for the sake of her children. Fatima has been an Al Majmoua borrower for eight cycles, and almost all of her loans were used to pay for treatment for her child's illness. And still she would do anything in order to continue his treatment. She is a borrower in good standing.

Fatima is applying for a loan this time in order to improve her business, through buying a new, updated tailoring machine necessary for her business. This machine will help a lot in increasing her income, at the same time covering her son's medical expenses. She hopes to stay healthy and capable of covering almost all of her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy a new tailoring machine necessary for her business

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is 47 years old, widowed, and has two children. She owns a rental house and earns a profit of about 10,000 KES a month.

Annastacia is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy some building materials. She hopes to improve her family’s living standards and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase materials for building.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana, vive con dos hijos de 21 y 23 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios, ella es empleada y a la vez se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios, las ventas la realiza con sus compañeras de trabajo y algunos vecinos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de blusas, ropa interior, lociones, cremas, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar sus ingresos y para tener mejor variedad.
El objetivo de Ana es que algún día se pueda comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her two children aged 21 and 23. As well as being a maid, she sells clothing and accessories to her work colleagues and neighbours. 

Ana is seeking a loan to buy blouses, underwear, lotions, and creams. This purchase will help her earn more money and have a wider variety of items to sell.

Her long-term goal is to buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy blouses, underwear, lotions, and creams

loans.name: Bismark

texts.es:
Bismark reside en un barrio muy  poblado del municipio de El Sauce, donde ha vivido toda su vida, desde pequeño aprendió a generar sus propios ingresos,  desde entonces adquirió experiencia como Barbero, esto  le ha permitido llevar siempre el sustento a su hogar.

En la actualidad tiene su propia Barbería, ubicada en su vivienda, donde brinda el servicio de corte de cabello a caballeros de todo el municipio de El Sauce. Es un negocio concurrido, sobre todo por jóvenes que acuden a este lugar por el buen servicio y la agilidad del mismo.

En estos momentos necesita un crédito para compra de cemento, perlines y ladrillos,  para mejorar su vivienda, dando así mejores condiciones de vida a su familia,  un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por este motivo  se acercó a Ceprodel para solicitar su apoyo, con la esperanza  que le puedan ayudar con dicha solicitud, confía en Dios poder lograr  sus objetivos,      mantener su negocio y a sus clientes satisfechos. Le estará agradecido a esta institución.
texts.en:
Bismark lives in a densely-populated neighbourhood in the municipality of El Sauce where he’s lived his whole life. As a child he learned how to earn his own money and eventually became a barber. This work has enabled him to support his family.

Currently he has his own barbershop located in his house where he cuts the hair of men from all over El Sauce. It’s very busy as young people above all go there because of the good service and skills provided by Bismark.

Now he needs a loan to buy cement, metal beams, and bricks to improve his house. His family will have a better place to live and his clients a more comfortable environment. For this reason Bismark has approached Ceprodel to ask for their support. He hopes that the institution will be able to help him, and he trusts in God that he will be able to achieve his goals, continue with his business, and have satisfied clients. He is grateful to the institution.

loans.use: to buy cement, metal beams, and bricks

loans.name: Marlyn Raquel

texts.es:
Marlyn, se dedica a la venta de ropa, vive con sus dos hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, la casa es familiar, ella tiene dos años de estar en la venta de ropa y es empleada, de estas dos ocupaciones ha logrado mantener a sus hijos y brindarles lo necesario.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de más mercadería, porque quiere mejorar y crecer en las ventas, comprara blusas, faldas, ropa interior, camisas, con esto estará diversificando el negocio.
Su aspiración es mejorar el negocio a través de los préstamos, ya que su familia depende de ella directamente.
texts.en:
Marlyn sells clothing. She lives with her two children aged 12 and 8 in the family home. She’s had her clothes-selling job for two years and works as a maid as well. These two jobs enable her to support her children and provide them with the basic necessities.

Marlyn is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise as she wishes to grow her business and make more sales. She plans to buy blouses, skirts, underwear, and shirts and in this way diversify her stock. Her goal is to improve her business by accessing loans as her family depends on her directly.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, underwear, and shirts

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 38 years old, married, and has two children.He sells cereals, which he has been doing for four years. His monthly income from the business is 20,000 KES.

Francis is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy cereals cereals, such as rice and maize, beans, and green gram (mung beans) to sell. Francis hopes to open a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, such as rice and maize, beans, and green grams.

loans.name: Idimoh

texts.ru: Идимох трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина Она замужем и любящая мать пятерых детей. Она занимается купле- продажей детской одежды в торговом центре. Она приобретает товар 1-2 раза в неделю. Когда она ездит за товаром её дочери помогают по бизнесу. Имеет много постоянных клиентов. Идимох запрашивает займ для покупки детской одежды с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Idimoh is a hardworking and purposeful woman. She is married and the loving mother of five children. She is engaged in buying and selling children's clothing at the mall. She purchases goods 1-2 times per week. When she travels to get the goods, her daughters help with the business. Idimoh has many regular customers. 

Idimoh requests a loan for the purchase of children's clothing with a goal of expanding her business. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Flora works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Flora is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her cafeteria.

Flora has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Ding

texts.en:
Ding lives in Bor. She sells food at a stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Ding heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,200 SDG in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Cristina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cristina es una joven emprendedora de 21 años que vive en Santo Domingo, que es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador. Su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. Esta ciudad y cantón es la capital de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Cristina desde que era adolecente traba vendiendo cosméticos y ropa para poder aportar a su economía. Ella trabaja y estudia. Al momento ella está cursando la educación universitaria. Cristina desea invertir en ropa y cosméticos para así incrementar su Stock y de esta manera dar más variedad a su clientela y por ende incrementar sus ventas.

Ella desea mejorar su calidad de vida, para ello se valdrá de su primer préstamo y así logrará la inversión planificada.
texts.en:
Cristina is a young 21-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Santo Domingo, which is the fourth most populous city in Ecuador. Its population is starting to grow rapidly, as it has a rich commercial sector and the largest cattle market in the country. It is located in the humid tropical region of Latin America. This city and canton is the capital of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which is considered a new province, since it was created in 2007.

Since she was teenager, Cristina has worked selling cosmetics and clothing, to be able to contribute to her finances. She works and goes to school. At the moment, she is going to university. Cristina wishes to invest in clothing and cosmetics to increase her stock, and this way offer her customers more variety and thereby increase her sales.

She wishes to improve her quality of life, so she will make use of her first loan and accomplish the planned investment.

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Herberth Ovidio

texts.es:
Herberth, es comerciante de mariscos, vive con su esposa y en casa propia, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad,  tiene 15 años de estar en el negocio, vendiendo todos los días.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en pescado, camarones, ostras, conchas, que con ello espera  mejorar el servicio a los clientes, surtiéndolo de productos frescos.
La aspiración de Herberth es tener mayores ganancias y rentabilidad en su negocio, para beneficiar a la familia.
texts.en:
Herberth is a seafood merchant. He lives with his wife in his own house and has two sons, who are 8 and 2 years of age. He has had his business, selling fish everyday, for 15 years.

Herberth is applying for a loan to invest in fish, shrimp, oysters, scallops so that he can improve service to his customers by stocking fresh products. His aspiration is to earn more income and profit in his business in order to help his family.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, oysters and scallops.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 27 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Loida runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell in her variety store.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Loida would like to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, aged 28, is married to Leah and they are blessed with one child. He has been selling clothes and shoes for the last four years. His monthly income from the business is KES 65,000.

This is Paul’s second loan from KADET LTD and he has a good credit history. He will use the loan to buy more clothes and shoes. Paul hopes to open another boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Guillermo Manuel

texts.es:
Guillermo es un joven de 25 años, el cual vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por la Laguna de Huacachina la cual se encuentra rodeada por dunas y es uno de los atractivos turísticos de la ciudad; como buen peruano le guata mucho la comida, por ello uno de los paltos favoritos es el riquísimo Lomo saltado, el estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería de sistemas.

Guillermo trabaja actualmente como chofer de mototaxi, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 45 clientes el dia, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque brinda un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Guillermo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar un equipo de autoradio para su vehículo con el cual hará que los clientes se sientan mas cómodos cuando usen sus servicios, así los clientes estarán satisfechos y el seguirá trabajando para seguir día a día luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener una mototaxi propia”.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a 25 year old young man who lives in the city of Ica. The city is characterized by its hot climate throughout all seasons of the year and also by the Laguna de Huacachina (Huacachina Lake), which is surrounded by sand dunes and is one of the tourist attractions of the city. Like a good Peruvian, Guillermo greatly enjoys food and one of his favorite dishes is the very delicious “loma saltado.” He studied until the fifth grade in high school but would have liked to study systems engineering.

Guillermo currently works as a motor taxi driver and spends about 12 hours every day at his business and can transport up to 45 clients a day. He believes his business is doing well because he provides good service to his customers.

Guillermo is very grateful to Kiva lenders since with their help he will be able to buy car radio equipment for his vehicle so that his customers will feel more comfortable while using his service. Thus they will be satisfied and he will continue working and fighting day after day to fulfill his great dream of owing his own motor taxi.

loans.use: to purchase a car radio for his vehicle.

loans.name: Akech

texts.en:
Akech lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has no children.
 
Akech heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her third loan from BRAC. 

She has requested a loan of 1500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is from Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Antonina is widowed and has six children. 

To make a living, Antonina owns a fish selling business venture. She has been engaged in her business for twenty-nine years and earns 20,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Antonina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is 46 years old and single. Six years ago she opened a small grocery store in her village and is very proud of this step, because she is working hard to prove that although she is a woman, she can make a successful business of her own.

Hala is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which will help her increase her selection of merchandise with special goods bought with special offers. Hala is a hardworking woman with an excellent reputation, liked by most of her customers who work hard on supporting her to develop her business as much as she can. In addition to food and candies, Hala also sells kitchenware products and hopes to expand her business by starting to sell most household items.

loans.use: to increase her selection of merchandise.

loans.name: Allakandeme Group

texts.fr:
Allakademe est un regroupement de 5 femmes ayant en moyenne 44  ans, 6 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à Bounounkobougou, un des quartiers de la ville de Yanfolila (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de beignet au poisson avec Noumousso , de la restauration et de la vente de céréales.
Noumousso, avec un poisson et une poêle en main  compte acheter avec son  prêt 100kg de farine,  20kg de poissons, 30litres d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de YANFOLILA.auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de YANFOLILA et à domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et d’enfants, en détail, au comptant et à crédit payable journalièrement ou hebdomadairement. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.000.FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Allakademe is a group of five women who are, on average, 44 years old and have six children.  They all live in traditional families in Bounounkobougou, one of the districts of the city of Yanfolila (the third administrative region of Mali).
They have taken out their eighth joint loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the demand of their customers.  Along with Noumousso, these women are in the business of selling fried fish and cereals, and food service.
Noumousso, with a fish and a frying pan in her hand, plans to buy 100 kg. of flour, 20 kg. of fish, and 30 liters of oil with her loan.  She gets her supplies at the main market in Yanfolila from wholesalers.  She makes her sales at the market in Yanfolila and from home to a clientele composed mainly of women and children, at retail, for cash and on credit, payable daily or weekly. 
She foresees making an average monthly profit of 32,000 FCFA.   A part of this will be used to assist her husband with daily expenses and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing fried fish.

loans.name: Juntas Y Unidas Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Luisa ; ella tiene  44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos;  La socia alterna sus actividades con el negocio de compra y venta de libros, también cosméticos  por catalogo,  la socia desea invertir en la compra de libros al por mayor ella ha hecho un pedido que le llegara en dos semanas y para ello requiere pagar el total del envió.  La socia también invertirá el préstamo para comprar algunos productos de belleza en oferta  por catalogo.
Los otros socios se dedican a la compra y venta de materiales de construcción, a la atención de la tienda de abarrotes, a la elaboración de tortas, a la venta de tejidos, a la docencia, al servicio de taxi,   atención de su pollería.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Sra. Luisa belongs to the “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS” Communal Bank. The bank is located in Huanchac district, belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Luisa is 44 years old and married with 3 children. She divides her time between her business buying and selling books and also selling cosmetics by catalog. She wants to invest in the purchase of books wholesale and has requested that they arrive in two weeks and therefore is required to pay the total shipping costs. She will also invest the loan in the purchase of some beauty products on sale in the catalog.

Other members of the bank work at buying and selling construction materials, managing a grocery store, making tortas, selling woven goods, teaching, driving a taxi and running a poultry shop.

Luisa is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase some discounted beauty products by catalog.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Reyna Isabel habita una comunidad  Los Limones un poblado cercano al municipio de El Sauce de donde es originaria, Se dedica a laborar como maestra de primaria donde tiene muchos años de experiencia, oficio que le ha permitido tener su propia vivienda, bienes del hogar con el fin de tener mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.

Tiene varios años de trabajar con Ceprodel se  le han otorgado cuatro  créditos para la compra de ganado, lo que hoy agradece porque gracias a estos créditos ha aumentado su inventario ganadero de donde obtiene beneficios como la leche de sus vacas que le sirven para el sustento de su familia o la ganancia de la venta de teneros para invertirla en mejoras de su vivienda.

En estos momentos tiene la necesidad de adquirir otro préstamo para compra de terneros con el fin de engordarlos y venderlos en un período de un año y con dicha ganancia adquirir un bien o mejorar su vivienda por lo que espera nuevamente el apoyo de ceprodel ya que de otra manera no pudiera realizar su objetivo.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel lives in Los Limones, a village near to the municipality of El Sauce, which is where she originally comes from. She works as a primary school teacher and has many years of experience in this profession. The job has allowed her to buy her own home and household articles, thus providing her family with a better quality of life.

She has worked with Ceprodel for several years. They have already given her four loans to buy livestock. Reyna Isabel is very grateful for this help, because thanks to these loans she had increased her stock of cattle. This has provided her with benefits such as milk from the cows, which she uses to feed her family, and income from selling calves. She invests this money in home improvements. 

Reyna Isabel currently needs another loan to buy calves. Her plan is to fatten them up and sell them in a year’s time. With the proceeds she hopes to buy a property or make improvements to her home. She hopes that Ceprodel will help her once again, since this is the only way she will be able to fulfil her aims.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es: Don José Medardo es casado con 4 hijos, algunos de sus hijos son estudiantes y dependen de el, su esposa se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa nueva. Anteriormente don José trabajaba como maestro de educación primaria y por problemas de salud tuvo que dejar su trabajo, siendo que el no quería ser una carga para su familia decidió poner una chiclera en el parque de la comunidad. El préstamo que don José solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de todo tipo de dulces, chicles, chocolates, galletas, confites, etc. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá surtir su chiclera y seguir aportando para la alimentación, educación y salud de sus hijos. Los ingresos de don José no son muchos, así que su mayor deseo es el de aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar. Don José es cliente de FAMA desde hace varios ciclos y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: José Medardo is married with 4 children. His children all go to school and depend on him. His wife sells shoes and new clothing. Previously, José worked as a primary school teacher but because of health issues he had to leave his job. As he didn’t want to be a burden on his family, he decided to open a candy stand in the community park. José is requesting a loan to invest in the buying of all kinds of sweets, gum, chocolates, cookies, candies, etc. With this loan, he can stock his candy stand and continue to contribute financially to the feeding, education and health of his children. José’s income is not very much so his biggest dream is to increase his income in order to improve the household earnings. José has been a client of FAMA for many cycles and has always paid his loans on time.

loans.use: buy sweets, gum, chocolates, cookies, candies, etc.

loans.name: Anon

texts.en:
Anon lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Anon heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese Pounds (SDG) in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en: Basilia is 43 years old, married, and has six children. With two children in school, Basilia works very hard to provide for them. Basilia runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store. Basilia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as detergents, soaps, and other miscellaneous items. In the future Basilia would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Abul

texts.en: Abul lives in Bor. She sells food at a stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. Abul heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase onions and sugar for her food stall. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Kantus Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Kantus” es un banco comunal que pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa y está conformado por personas responsables. Sus reuniones del banco comunal van a ser cada treinta días y todos los socios tienen que estar presentes en las reuniones programadas sino van a pagar una multa. La mayoría de los socios son vecinos y tienen una buena amistad. Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. (La socia Isabel está levantando la mano en la fotografia). 

La socia Isabel vive en la ciudad del Cusco (Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.). Isabel nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comida, ella tiene un restaurante donde expende desayuno, almuerzo y cena, ella abre el restaurante desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de noche de lunes a domingos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cerveza, gaseosas y otras cosas que se necesitan para preparar comida. 

La socia Isabel se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Kantus” is part of the Arariwa Association and was formed by responsible people. The meetings will be every 30 days and every member must be in attendance or they will be fined. A majority of the members are neighbors and have good friendships. The members are hard-working entrepreneurs who look for opportunities to get ahead and with their daily efforts hope to give their children a better future. 

Isabel, (the one with her hand up in the photo), lives in the city of Cusco. Cusco is a well-known tourist destination because of its traditional fiesta of the sun, “Inti Raymi” and because it is the stepping stone to one of the wonders of the world, “Machupicchu”.
Isabel tells us that she sells food. She has a restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. She opens at 7 in the morning and closes at 9 in the evening, Monday to Sunday. She’s been running this business for many years now and it’s going quite well. She is requesting this loan to buy more beer, soda and other ingredients she needs to prepare food. 

Isabel is grateful for the opportunity she has been given through this Association and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: buy more beer, soda and other ingredients she needs to prepare food.

loans.name: Niurys De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La joven Niurys de los Ángeles es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, estudia  tercer año de contabilidad, y labora como secretaria para una Institución privada en el mismo municipio, donde está adquiriendo experiencia en su profesión.

Ella es  soltera, con muchos deseos de superación,    trabajadora, que desde   su poca edad  su mamá le ha inculcado a ser una mujer valiente y luchadora,  con  espíritu de superación y honestidad.

Es el primer crédito que solicita en ceprodel, para pagar por adelantado mensualidades en la universidad, y que este  no sea obstáculo para culminar su carrera profesional, por lo que espera la ayuda de esta  financiera para pagar dichos gastos,  y así llegar a tener un  futuro mejor como profesional,  lo que le estará  agradecida  por el apoyo que le briden.
texts.en:
Niurys de los Ángeles comes from El Sauce. This young lady is in her third year of accountancy studies and also works as a secretary for a private company in the same town, where she is gaining experience in her chosen profession. 
 
She is single, ambitious and hard-working. When she was very young her mother taught her the importance of being courageous and determined, motivated and virtuous.

This is the first time she has applied to Ceprodel for a loan. She plans to use it to pay her monthly university fees in advance, so that the fees do not become an obstacle to her completing her studies. She hopes that Ceprodel will help her to meet these costs so that she can become a professional in future. She would be very grateful for this support.

loans.use: to pay for university.

loans.name: Gemeniano

texts.en:
Gemeniano is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 55 years old,  married, and has five children. Gemeniano has a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for 31 years and earns 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2008, Gemeniano joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to do business. Gemeniano is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.
